meanings.definition: The electric current produced when light is absorbed by a material.
meanings.sent1: Photocurrents can be used to generate electricity from sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photocurrents to understand how solar panels work.
meanings.sent3: The photocurrents in the solar cell were so strong, they powered the entire house.
meanings.sent4: The photocurrents flowed through the material like a river of energy.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering photocurrents danced across the surface, creating a beautiful light show.

meanings.definition: The flow of electric charge in a photovoltaic cell when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: Photocurrents are essential for solar panels to convert sunlight into electricity.
meanings.sent2: The efficiency of a solar panel depends on the strength of the photocurrents it produces.
meanings.sent3: When the sun rose, the photocurrents in the solar cell woke up and started working.
meanings.sent4: The photocurrents raced through the solar cell like excited runners in a relay.
meanings.sent5: I could almost hear the hum of the photocurrents as they powered up the device.
